required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Profile and Safety of the Tobacco Heating System 2.2 Menthol (THS 2.2 Menthol)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, Randomized, Controlled, Crossover Study to Investigate the Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Profile and Safety of Tobacco Heating System 2.2 Menthol (THS 2.2 Menthol) Following Single Use in Smoking, Healthy Subjects Compared to Menthol Conventional Cigarettes and Nicotine Nasal Spray

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetic (PK) profiles (rate and amount of nicotine absorbed) after a single use of the THS 2.2 Menthol (mTHS 2.2) compared to a single use of the menthol conventional cigarette (mCC) and nicotine nasal spray (NNS).

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Nicotine Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
primary_outcome.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares (geometric LS) means are provided.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Nicotine Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero (Pre-product Use) to Last Time Point [AUC(0-last)] Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
primary_outcome.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares means are provided.

arm_group.description: Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mCC).

Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mCC) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2).

Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single administration of NNS)

Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single administration of NNS) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2).

intervention.description: Single use of subject's own mCC
Single administration of 1 mg of nicotine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is aged from 22 to 65 years (inclusive).
- Smoking, healthy subject as judged by the Investigator.
- Subject smoked at least 10 commercially available menthol CCs per day (with brand restrictions) over the last 4 weeks.
- Subject has smoked for at least the last 3 consecutive years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- As per Investigator judgment, the subject cannot participate in the study for any reason (e.g., medical, psychiatric, and/or social reason).
- Subject has received medication within 14 days or within 5 half-lives of a drug (whichever is longer) which has an impact on CYP2A6 activity.
- Female subject is pregnant or breast feeding.
- Female subject does not agree to use an acceptable method of effective contraception.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study initiated (first subject screened): 02 October 2013 At admission (Day -1), all the subjects performed a product trial (mTHS 2.2 and subsequently NNS). From enrollment, they were asked to remain abstinent from smoking for at least 24 hours (Day 0) before being randomized on Day 1 into 1 of the 4 sequences.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled population = 64 subjects: 2 exposed to mTHS 2.2 and NNS at Admission but not randomized and 62 randomized as described below: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC": 22 subjects Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2": 22 subjects Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS": 9 subjects Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2": 9 subjects

group.title: mTHS 2.2 Then mCC
group.description: Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mCC).

group.title: mCC Then mTHS 2.2
group.description: Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mCC) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2).

group.title: mTHS 2.2 Then NNS
group.description: Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single administration of NNS)

group.title: NNS Then mTHS 2.2
group.description: Each subject will follow the below study design: Day 0 = Wash-out (1 day) Day 1 = 1st intervention (single administration of NNS) Day 2 = wash-out Day 3 = 2nd intervention (single product use of mTHS 2.2).

baseline.population: PK population: all randomized subjects who completed at least 1 of the single-use days, with at least 1 derived PK parameter. 62 randomized subjects : 44 in Group 1, 18 in Group 2. PK population = 58 => 41 in Group 1 (2 withdrawn + 1 excluded due to major protocol deviation), 17 in Group 2 (1 withdrawn).

group.title: Group 1
group.description: This population comprises the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: Group 2
group.description: This population comprises the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

measure.title: International Organization for Standardization (ISO) nicotine yield

outcome.title: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Nicotine Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
outcome.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares (geometric LS) means are provided.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetics (PK) populations consisted of all the randomized subjects who completed at least 1 of the single use days (Days 1 or 3), and for whom at least 1 PK parameter could be derived. Subjects with major protocol deviations that impacted the evaluability of the results were excluded from the PK populations.

group.title: mTHS 2.2 - Group 1
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: mCC - Group 1
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: mTHS 2.2 - Group 2
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: NNS - Group 2
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

measure.title: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Nicotine Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
measure.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares (geometric LS) means are provided.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetics (PK) populations consisted of all the randomized subjects who completed at least 1 of the single use days (Days 1 or 3), and for whom at least 1 PK parameter could be derived. Subjects with major protocol deviations that impacted the evaluability of the results were excluded from the PK populations.

analysis.groups_desc: The objective of this study was to determine the point estimate and precision of the nicotine bioavailability (ratio of mTHS 2.2:mCC) for Cmax, therefore, there was no statistical hypothesis to be tested for this objective.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Nicotine Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero (Pre-product Use) to Last Time Point [AUC(0-last)] Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
outcome.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares means are provided.
outcome.population: PK populations consisted of all the randomized subjects who completed at least 1 of the single use days (Days 1 or 3), and for whom at least 1 PK parameter could be derived. Subjects with major protocol deviations that impacted the evaluability of the results were excluded from the PK populations.

group.title: mTHS 2.2 - Group 1
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2".

group.title: mCC - Group 1
group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2"

group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

group.description: The geometric least squares mean presented below takes into consideration the data of the subjects who were randomized in the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Nicotine Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero (Pre-product Use) to Last Time Point [AUC(0-last)] Following Single Use of mTHS 2.2, mCC and NNS
measure.description: Derived from multiple blood sampling on Day 1 and Day 3 (1 blood sampling pre-product use and multiple blood sampling over 24 hours post-product use). Geometric Least Squares means are provided.
measure.population: PK populations consisted of all the randomized subjects who completed at least 1 of the single use days (Days 1 or 3), and for whom at least 1 PK parameter could be derived. Subjects with major protocol deviations that impacted the evaluability of the results were excluded from the PK populations.

analysis.groups_desc: The objective of this study was to determine the point estimate and precision of the nicotine bioavailability (ratio of mTHS 2.2:mCC) for AUC(0-last), therefore, there was no statistical hypothesis to be tested for this objective.

reported_events.time_frame: From the informed consent form (ICF) signature until the end of the safety follow-up period (7 days after discharge of the subject)
reported_events.desc: The safety was assessed in the safety population, consisting of 64 subjects: 62 randomized subjects (44 in Group 1, 18 in Group 2) and 2 subjects exposed to mTHS 2.2 and NNS from the product trials on Day -1 but not randomized.

group.title: Group 1
group.description: This population comprises the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then mCC" Sequence "mCC then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: Group 2
group.description: This population comprises the following sequences: Sequence "mTHS 2.2 then NNS" Sequence "NNS then mTHS 2.2"

group.title: Enrolled But Not Randomized
group.description: Subjects who tried the mTHS 2.2 at Admission (Day -1) but were not randomized in 1 of the 2 groups as they were back-up subjects

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: We confirm we have the contractual provisions in place which specifies that in no event will the study site be allowed to disclose to any third party (or publicly release) any information obtained through the study without the CRO's prior written consent which in turn cannot provide such consent without Sponsor's approval unless such publication is made to satisfy regulatory requirements. The Intellectual Property rights and research results from the present study belongs to the Sponsor.
